intro: Cyphostemma strigosum, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, despite its appearance. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature. Cyphostemma strigosum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
